info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 24 at 8:37PM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Benton County through 930 PM EDT... At 836 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Boswell, or 13 miles southeast of Milford, moving east northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fowler, Otterbein, Oxford, Boswell, Ambia, Templeton, Swanington and Dunnington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Brief but torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
